generif.text: down regulation of GD3 synthase is associated with reduction in GD3 ganglioside expression affecting tumorigenesis and metastasis in F-11 cells.
Human GD3 synthase gene consisted of five exons and span about 135 kilobases. The 5'-flanking region lacked canonical TATA and CAAT boxes, but contained SP1 binding site(s) as in rat and mouse

findings suggest that the disialoganglioside(GD3) synthase gene represents a physiological modulator of vascular smooth muscle cell responses that may contribute to plaque instability in atherosclerosis
has an apoptotic effect on ECV304 cells through downregulation of Bcl-2 expression via dephosphorylation of AKT and CREB
calnexin controls the biological outcome of GD3 accumulation and reveals a novel role in the stress response
The cloning and characterization of ST8SIA1 in humans is reported.
Transcriptional regulation of GD3S expression in Fas-induced Jurkat T-cells shows a critical role of NF-kappa B in regulated expression.
effects of small interfering (si) RNAs against GD3 synthase gene on the expression of ganglioside GD2 and biological phenotypes of human lung cancer cells expressing GD2.
These results indicate that NF-kappaB plays an essential role in the transcriptional activity of human GD3 synthase gene essential for GD3 synthesis

This work advances the hypothesis that GD3 induces a post-translational modification of histone H1 thus influencing the apoptosis process through transcriptional activation/repression of specific genes.

The functions of four conserved residues between the L and S sialylmotifs in human GD3-synthase were investigated, and it was found that these sites are involved in determining the alpha2,8-linkage specificity of GD3-synthase.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Two independent studies support an allelic association of multiple sclerosis with polymorphisms in the ST8SIA1 gene.
Data propose that the recruitment of TG2 into membranes by GD3 might play an important role in the erythroid differentiation in K562 cells.
Ganglioside GD3-Synthase was associated with poor pathohistological grading in breast cancer
Isolation and functional characterization of the human glioblastoma-specific promoter region of the human GD3 synthase (hST8Sia1) gene are reported.
G(D3) synthase overexpression may contribute to increasing the malignant properties of breast cancer cells.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Variants in ST8SIA1 do not play a major role in susceptibility to multiple sclerosis in Canadian families.
GD3 has a role in hypoxia susceptibility by disabling the c-Src/NF-kappaB survival pathway resulting in lower Mn-SOD expression
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Results show that G(D3) synthase expression is sufficient to enhance the tumorigenicity of MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells through a ganglioside-dependent activation of the c-Met receptor.
This indicates that ST8Sia I is able to act as an oligosialyltransferase in a cellular context.
TNF-alpha and IL-6 secreted from keratinocytes enhanced ST8SIA1 expression in melanocytes.
our study provides support for the GD3-induced cell cycle arrest, disruption of integrin-b1-mediated anchorage, inhibition of angiogenesis and thereby induced apoptosis in pancreatic cancer cells.

Results show that GD3S regulates stem cell function via c-Met and the expression of GD3S is regulated by FOXC2, a transcription factor functioning downstream of several epithelial-mesenchymal transition signaling pathways.

Though results are limited by the small sample size, variants in BDNF and ST8SIA may slow down the early response to antidepressants in subjects non-exposed to stressors at the illness onset, with a remarkable gene-environment interaction
GD3 and GD3S are highly expressed in glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) stem cell, play a key role in glioblastoma tumorigenicity, and are potential therapeutic targets against GBM.

Data suggest that ganglioside glycosyltransferases ST3GAL5, ST8SIA1, and B4GALNT1 are S-acylated at conserved cysteine residues located close to cytoplasmic border of their transmembrane domains; ST3Gal-II is acylated at conserved cysteine residue in N-terminal cytoplasmic tail; for B4GALNT1 and ST3Gal-II, dimer formation controls their S-acylation status.
altered expression of miR-33a/let-7e was correlated with ST8SIA1 level, which might contribute to CRC progression
These results from genotype-phenotype analysis might suggest a possible link between the ST8SIA1 functional promoter haplotype and the clinical severity of TAO [thyroid-associated ophthalmopathy].
These results suggest that curcumin controls hST8Sia I gene expression via AMPK signal pathway in A549 cells.
these data demonstrate the mechanism by which ST8SIA1 regulates tumor growth and metastasis in triple-negative breast cancer.
genetic variants at the genes SSH1 and ST8SIA1 were related to the genetic predisposition to early-onset periodontitis that is in part triggered by smoking
TNFalpha-signal and cAMP-mediated signals oppositely regulate melanoma- associated ganglioside GD3 synthase gene in human melanocytes.
ST8SIA1 inhibition sensitizes triple negative breast cancer to chemotherapy via suppressing Wnt/beta-catenin and FAK/Akt/mTOR.
Comprehensive Transcriptomic Analysis Identifies ST8SIA1 as a Survival-Related Sialyltransferase Gene in Breast Cancer.

Knockdown of lncRNA MIR44352HG and ST8SIA1 expression inhibits the proliferation, invasion and migration of prostate cancer cells in vitro and in vivo by blocking the activation of the FAK/AKT/betacatenin signaling pathway.
BACH1 Binding Links the Genetic Risk for Severe Periodontitis with ST8SIA1.
Long noncoding RNA NR2F1-AS1 plays a carcinogenic role in gastric cancer by recruiting transcriptional factor SPI1 to upregulate ST8SIA1 expression.
Possible regulation of ganglioside GD3 synthase gene expression with DNA methylation in human glioma cells.
The yes-associated protein (YAP) is associated with resistance to anti-GD2 immunotherapy in neuroblastoma through downregulation of ST8SIA1.

reactome.name: Biosynthesis of the N-glycan precursor (dolichol lipid-linked oligosaccharide, LLO) and transfer to a nascent protein
Synthesis of substrates in N-glycan biosythesis

summary: Gangliosides are membrane-bound glycosphingolipids containing sialic acid. Ganglioside GD3 is known to be important for cell adhesion and growth of cultured malignant cells. The protein encoded by this gene is a type II membrane protein that catalyzes the transfer of sialic acid from CMP-sialic acid to GM3 to produce gangliosides GD3 and GT3. The encoded protein may be found in the Golgi apparatus and is a member of glycosyltransferase family 29. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2015].
